content.question: Which of the following techniques could best reduce the harmful effects of overfishing if it were to be widely adopted by the fishing industry?

choices.label: Increased use of large-mesh gill nets for harvesting salmon and trout
Greater reliance on bottom trawling in coastal waters for harvesting shrimp and sole
Increased use of long-line fishing techniques in the open ocean for harvesting swordfish and halibut
Widespread application of cyanide in tropical waters for harvesting tuna and cod

content.answer: Increased use of large-mesh gill nets for harvesting salmon and trout

skill.text: Skill 7.B: Describe potential responses or approaches to environmental problems.
